Authors: Long Fei Fan, Fang Wu, Yu Cheng Dai, Jin bao Pu
Title:
A new species of Tremella s.s. (Tremellales, Basidiomycota)
from southeastern China
Keywords:
Jelly fungi, phylogenetic analysis, taxonomy,
Tremellaceae
Abstract:
A new species Tremella zhejiangensis is described from
southeastern China based on phenotypic and molecular evidence. The
species is characterized by soft gelatinous, yellowish brown to brownish
orange, cerebriform basidioma when fresh, thin-walled, globose to
subglobose or broad ellipsoid basidia with a basal clamp connection,
globose to subglobose basidiospores measuring 15.019.0 × 14.017.5 µm,
with obvious apiculus, and growing on rotten wood of Liquidambar
formosana. The phylogeny of Tremella s.s. is constructed using methods
of Maximum parsimony, Maximum likelihood and Bayesian analyses based on
the combined internal transcribed spacer regions (ITS), internal
transcribed spacer regions (ITS) and the large subunit (nLSU) dataset
respectively. The results indicate that T. zhejiangensis forms a lineage
independent of other species lineage from other species. The illustrated
description of the new species is provided and their related species are
discussed.
